(DEN).  Eagle County Airport is also an option for travelers.  Numerous car and bus shuttles are available for transport from the airport.
The activities and services in the area are spread out around the resort and the adjacent town of

. Keystone Resort provides free transportation by shuttle bus on 15 minute regular schedules to all resort lodging, ski area, and lodge. The Summit Stage, a free bus service, provides service between the resorts in Summit county, and to the towns of Dillon, Frisco, and Breckenridge in addition to Keystone. They also stop at the grocery store, target, and within easy walking distance of anything you might need during your stay.

When you arrive at Keystone, right down the road is the old mining town of Montezuma, and you can take a scenic Jeep tour up the side of the mountain to Saint John's, another old mining town, with some beautiful scenery.

Skiing at Keystone is great from the base area, and from the River Run area. It is a great place to ski in the winter, but has some great events in the summer. One of the most fun events is the Blues Festival. Here, they have music and some really great food. It is usually on the 2nd weekend of July.

value: content=Guided Snowmobile Tours and Self Guided Snowmobile Rentals in the Keystone Backcountry.

There are many places in Keystone where you can rent ski and snowboard equipment for your stay in Beaver Creek. 

Here are just a few of the many equipment rental stores found in Keystone

value: Black Tie (Which also offer full delivery service to your accommodation)

content=The Bighorn Steakhouse serves only the finest cuts of corn-fed American beef. Additionally, there is a wide variety of appetizers including blue corn crab fritters and caramelized Colorado goat cheese, wild game, fresh sustainable seafood, slow roasted natural chicken and other specialty entrees to tempt your palate.
content=Enjoy a delicious lunch on the shores of Keystone Lake in this casual family café.

content=Discover one of the best-kept secrets around. Nestled next to the Bighorn Steakhouse in Keystone Lodge & Spa, this cozy lounge features comfortable seating around a crackling fire in the floor to ceiling stone fireplace, a full bar, and live entertainment on the weekends.

content=Surrounded by the majestic Rocky Mountains and thousands of acres of national forest, Keystone Lodge & Spa offers 152 rooms (including 14 loft suites), magnificent views and easy access to Keystone’s numerous outdoor adventures, including skiing, ice skating, mountain biking and more. The longest-honored resort member of Preferred Hotels & Resorts, this AAA Four Diamond Award-winning lodge features a luxurious 10,000-square-foot RockResorts Spa®, 36 holes of award-winning golf, two restaurants, a cozy lounge, lakeside deli, fitness center and year-round indoor/outdoor pool and hot tub.
directions=Located in the Gateway Mountain Lodge building at the corner of Hwy 6 and the turn off into River Run Village
content=Keystone's largest independent property management company.

- Colorado is home to over 70 wineries and its own indigenous vineyards, some of the highest in the world. Wine lovers can enjoy several scenic day trips from Keystone to many of the small towns that grow their own grapes. These lovely little communities include
. This is a day trip by car.
